website_summaries.verdict: A popular, multi-purpose radiator cleaning fluid that works well on most clogs, resulting in better performance.
pros: Can clean clogged heater cores and gunked-up cooling systems
In many cases, one flush is all you will need for improved performance
cons: May not work for all clogs, or remove buildup from all leak-stopping products

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with hot coolant passing through the core.. Hose in was out, hose out was not, and no pressure on out hose. Mixed up the ThoroFlush as directed, poured into the core using a funnel and then blowing into the tubing I connected to force it in...did this until red started to trickle out. Let it sit for 5 minutes, flushed it, repeated with a 10 minute wait. Flush it out completely, refilled with 505/50 pre-mix, and checked the hoses. Both were hot, heat was working great and I can say this stuff really works! ;TLDR... It works, and is worth it over any garbage Prestone product.
customer_reviews.author: Ricka

customer_reviews.title: Did what is supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a life saver. Saw it advertised on TV on one of those auto rebuild shows. I messed up by adding green antifreeze to the red antifreeze in my '06 Tacoma. Clogged the heater core almost completely; probably clogged part of the radiator too but I couldn't tell. I used the flush precisely as outlined in the directions. I did however, dump the antifreeze and flushed with distilled water before adding the flush chemical. The end result was spectacular. After 3 years I now have heat in my truck...and you need it here in central Ohio. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: Worked when nothing else would
customer_reviews.text: I tried every flush product I could get locally after my 2005 Mustang started over heating. I even tried putting 3-4 in at a time. Nothing worked. I replaced the radiator, thermostat and water pump. Again nothing seems to help. After remembering that I had some old Bar leak in the system I thought I was give this product one last shot before I pulled the heads. When I reversed flushed it after a spirited drive with the ThoroFlush in everything came gushing out. Even particles of trapped casting sand from the block. Saved me thousands in repairs. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Breiten

customer_reviews.title: Truely commercial grade. Better than GM and Preston’s.
customer_reviews.text: I had tried Preston’s flush and GM’s flush for getting rid of dexcool sludge. They worked to some extent, but the car kept overheating. I tried this flush and got a whole bunch of dexcool crap out of the car. Now the temp is back to normal (was 215-230deg, is now 196-210deg) and I’m not loosing coolant due to overheating any more. This is no ordinary watered down stuff from the department store shelves. It is truely commercial grade. Deducting one star because it is not mentioned how to dispose it properly. I still holding on to it in containers.
customer_reviews.author: Yashar M. Aval

customer_reviews.title: Yes it works!
customer_reviews.text: My mechanic had tried every trick he knew of, and was unable to get a heater core cleaned out of some kind of stop-leak leftovers. I bought this and he used it... Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: RonC

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for DexCool sludge removal
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, as described, and in good condition. Good value. Coolant system had a leak which allowed air into system and resulted in Dexcool turning to solid/sludge. Thought car was done for. This product dissolved the sludge where other products had failed to have any success. Car is running great and heater core alive and well again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: It worked! Heater core was clogged, took the hoses off at the firewall to the heater core used some clamps on some extra garden hose to connect to the heater core followed the mixing instructions on the bottle and poored it in left it for an hour then flushed it out with the garden hose into a bucket, hooked normal hoses back up and refilled the list coolant, ran it a couple minutes and heaters blowing hot again!
customer_reviews.author: Aron Baer

customer_reviews.title: solved my high-temperature problems
customer_reviews.text: I had recurring high-temperature problems I was unable to track down. This stuff did the trick. Before I had read the directions I had drained my system, removed my thermostat and flushed with water multiple times. So, I ran this stuff through without the thermostat, mixed with just tap water for 15 minutes. Drained and flushed until clear hoping that I had run it long enough (directions say to add mixture and run engine up to temperature and then to run for 10-15 minutes). Totally worked. I used to baby this car, now I can drive like a total jerk (rabbit starts, zooming around, whatever) and it keeps steady temperature. Thoroflush is the best.
customer_reviews.author: PDXPaulie

customer_reviews.title: Jeep Wrangler JK Heat Problem Fixed!
customer_reviews.text: Flushed the heater core on my 2015 JK Wrangler with the "Poor driver side heat". Lots of sediment and junk washed out, now heat is blowing HOT! Flushed with a hose previously, with no results. This stuff works!
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works very well
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really cleans way deeper than anything I've used over the last 35 years. I ordered an additional bottle that I'll use on our other vehicle as an annual complete coolant system cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Durso

customer_reviews.title: It actually worked!
customer_reviews.text: Made the mistake of using a stop leak liquid on my Subaru Legacy for a leaking radiator. All it did is clog my heater core. The dealer wanted $800 to replace the core but I saw this recommended on a couple of auto forums. Used the appropriate amount for a 2 gallon system and within 5 minutes my heat was working again! Totally worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: C Scott

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for a clogged radiator
customer_reviews.text: I had a radiator that was severely clogged from using stop leak. Read the reviews and decided to try this product but it did not work any better than flushing with vinegar. I ended up replacing the radiator with a new one for $120 shipped from Amazon. Should have went that route to begin with and saved the money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions but it foamed up and the air in the system wouldn’t allow the product to circulate properly. By the time I got all the air bubbles out I lost so much of the product that I didn’t get results. I really hoped it would work..
customer_reviews.author: pinkboog

customer_reviews.title: I did not get the expected results
customer_reviews.text: After following all directions and using as specified, I did not get the expected results. I am still trying to use the product to get the results I desire.
customer_reviews.author: jay allen

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean a lot of crud inside of my engine block, follow directions carefully. This stuff is strong and effective
customer_reviews.author: Stirm

customer_reviews.title: Irontite worked great cleaning the cooling system of my Ford Model A
customer_reviews.text: Irontite worked great cleaning the cooling system of my Ford Model A. I had tried using white vinegar and plenty of water flushes, but the water kept coming out dirty. So I tried the Irontite and it cleaned it out in one flush. I couldn't believe how much crud came out!
customer_reviews.author: David R. Delano

customer_reviews.title: Good as far as I could tell
customer_reviews.text: Got my Land Rover running cooler along with a new thermostat. Don’t know which one did more. A little hard to get it all washed out properly but that’s more they systems fault and not the cleaners.
customer_reviews.author: kade

customer_reviews.title: Great decision!
customer_reviews.text: amazing! My Van heater was not working. The diagnosis was that the heating system was clogged. The cost ranged from 400 to 800 dollars, I saw the product and it struck me that it was the strongest and best for this type of problem. Use it to the letter and surprise! The heating returned and the whole system stabilized. I also ordered the product to seal antifreeze leaks I did the same. and La Van works very well. It was a great surprise and I saved a lot of $$ !! thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Franco

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is the product you use when all else fails... or just save a whole bunch of time and use this first. It's more expensive for a very good reason, it works better than the rest. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Ron W.

customer_reviews.title: Sandy
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to get this to dissolve fully in water. Trouble is you don’t know until you’ve already poured it in and you see the grit at the bottom of your vessel.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been having trouble with my 2008 Jeep jku heater core no joke This Thing Really Works.wow
customer_reviews.author: jimmywin9

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for my 6.0 oiler cooler clog. Was a pain in the ass to flush it all out. Wasted about three hours and 140$ for coolant and product.
customer_reviews.author: Meat

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend replacing thermostat with this flush
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work. cleaned out the radiator stop leak. Required a lot of flushes to get all the chemical out. Highly recommend replacing thermostat with this flush.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to mix into my coolant on my F150. The last owner put in stop leak and clogged everything up. This product actually cleaned everything out within 12 mins.

customer_reviews.title: Did not stop the leak in my water pump
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if I would use this stuff again or not. It left a lot of gunk in my radiator and hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Frequent Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this in my shop for years on cast iron engines. There's not a better product for flushing cooling systems in cast iron engines.
customer_reviews.author: Will H.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Used to unplug a heater core on a 03 CRV that had been plugged for 3 years saved me 2k in dealer repair bill.

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the heat back!
customer_reviews.text: ...even though I live in Florida! This stuff worked wonders on my cooling system.

customer_reviews.title: did not do anything
customer_reviews.text: It did not make any difference at all. my radiator was still clogged and still ran hotter than normal, Did not work t all.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Do not leave in your system! It will eat through any really bad rust areas, like radiators.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick, exactly as explained in the YouTube video for cleaning out the radiator

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff
customer_reviews.text: My truck was soooo filled with stop leak that I would flush the heater core and in a day it would clog and blow cold now it blows so hot I have to run it on low amazing stuff

customer_reviews.text: Did not work took forever to flush out of car

I really should flush it again only because I flushed gallons of water thew it untill it was clear it took so much rust an debris out it probably won't be a bad idea to.do it again

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Jeep Wrangler Jku heater Core improvement
customer_reviews.text: 2013 Jku Jeep Wrangler Heater Core improvement. Flushed just the heater core using a drill pump for about 10 minutes, flushed with water, them soaked the core again, and flushed with water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: After hundreds of items purchased from Amazon I have finally found a product worth writing a review for. This stuff works, just buy it!

customer_reviews.text: Stuff works great onto my 2nd flush after one more flush my heat will be working 100%. Must follow directions if you want it to work properly.

product_meta.title: Irontite ThoroFlush (468-9110-16)
feature_bullets: Industrial Strength concentrated radiator, engine coolant system and fuel tank cleaner
Loosens and removes rust, scale, grease, oil and sludge
Cleans Auto, HD Truck and Equipment Cooling Systems
Safe for use on Cast Iron, Aluminum or Plastic
